Pre-Game Insights: South Africa have never lost to Bangladesh in T20Is.
Both teams have shaky top orders.
South Africa's top order is struggling to score runs.
South Africa's bowlers have been in great form.
Bangladesh's quicks also came to the party against Sri Lanka.
Bangladesh's legspinner Rishad Hossain's 3 for 22 won him the Player-of-the-Match award.
Team News: Bangladesh are waiting on news of Shoriful Islam's fitness.
South Africa are unlikely to change the combination that has worked so far in New York.
Pitch and Conditions: Fast bowlers are likely to dominate in New York again and we should get low to middling totals.
A sunny day has been forecast.
Stats that Matter: South Africa's 3 for 3 against Netherlands was their lowest score for the loss of three wickets in a T20I
Bangladesh's win over Sri Lanka was their first win against a higher-ranked side at the T20 World Cup since they beat West Indies in 2007, the inaugural T20 World Cup
